qas.question: In what year was the name Porter first used for a dark beer?
In what year was the name stout first used to describe a dark beer?
What do you call a dark beer that is brewed with roasted malts or barley?
What type of yeast is used to make stout and porter beers?
In what country was Porter beer popular in 1721?
What name was first used in 1712?
What name was used as early as 1767?
What are made with slow fermenting malts?
What is Imperial porter a type of?

context: <a2_0><b7_0>Stout and porter<b7_0/><a2_0/> are <b8_0>dark beers<b8_0/> made using roasted malts or roast barley, and typically brewed with <a3_0>slow fermenting yeast<a3_0/>. There are a number of variations including Baltic porter, dry stout, and Imperial stout. The name <b5_0>Porter<b5_0/> was first used in <a0_0>1721<a0_0/> to describe a dark brown beer popular with the street and river porters of <a4_0>London<a4_0/>. This same beer later also became known as stout, though the word <b6_0>stout<b6_0/> had been used as early as <a1_0>1677<a1_0/>. The history and development of stout and porter are intertwined.
